octavia_load_balancer_health_monitor_for: The health monitor is used to determine the health of your pool members. Health checks are performed regularly on each pool member, and the results of these checks are used to determine whether the member is receiving new connections. Only one health monitor can be defined for each pool.
Must only contain numbers, letters, underscores, dashes or full stops.
The HTTP code considered a success
The HTTP status codes expected if the health check is successful. It must be a single number, a list of numbers separated by commas, or an interval (two numbers separated by a hyphen).
The number of connection failures allowed before marking the member as an error. Must be a number between 1 and 10. The default value is 3.
Interval between 2 Health Monitor tests. Must be greater than or equal to the timeout.
The number of connection failures allowed before marking the member as inactive. Must be a number between 1 and 10.
The time after which a health check stops. Must be a number greater than or equal to 0 and less than recurrence
